docs.snippet: The most charismatic player in the world championships in Tunisia last month was Zia Mahmood of Manhattan, a celebrated globe-trotter. In the past he has played in world championships for his native Pakistan, and twice led his team to the final of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The most charismatic player in the world championships in Tunisia last month was Zia Mahmood of Manhattan, a celebrated globe-trotter. In the past he has played in world championships for his native Pakistan, and twice led his team to the final of the Bermuda Bowl, but now he was representing the United States for the first time. He and his teammates, Seymon Deutsch, Michael Rosenberg, Paul Soloway, Chip Martel and Lew Stansby, were eliminated in the semifinal, but they made an elegant fashion statement. As a tribute to Zia, they appeared one day in long white Pakistani robes. This proved difficult for Martel, who is the smallest member of the team and had been supplied with an extralarge robe. Whether to shrink the robe or enlarge Martel was the problem, and the former proved simpler.
docs.abstract: Alan Truscott Cards column; comments on Zia Mahmood of Manhattan, describing him as most charismatic player in world bridge championships in Tunisia last month; diagram (M)

headline.main: Aided by 'Balmoral Coup,' Zia Sets Indian Club Slam

docs.snippet: For the last two decades, Britain has been represented regularly in international competition by Jeremy Flint, Tony Priday and Claude Rodrigue, a consistent and effective trio. In recent years they have often been joined by Robert Sheehan, and thi...
docs.lead_paragraph: For the last two decades, Britain has been represented regularly in international competition by Jeremy Flint, Tony Priday and Claude Rodrigue, a consistent and effective trio. In recent years they have often been joined by Robert Sheehan, and this foursome will be in the lists later this month in the world championships in the Netherlands. They will be joined by two talented youngsters, Roman Smolski and Tony Forrester. Like most great teams, the Flint quartet has an occasional tournament result it would prefer to forget. In the Woolwich Building Society Spring Foursomes in Eastbourne, England, this year, the Britons were eliminated from contention thanks largely to the diagramed deal, which left two famous players with red faces.

headline.main: Bridge: Flint Will Lead British Side In World Title Tournament

docs.snippet: "WHAT'S that you're reading?" asked my wife. "The jacket looks crazy." It does, too, being cartoons of two men and two women with the men's heads on the women's bodies and other surprising rearrangements. After a pause, while I searched for the mo...
docs.lead_paragraph: "WHAT'S that you're reading?" asked my wife. "The jacket looks crazy." It does, too, being cartoons of two men and two women with the men's heads on the women's bodies and other surprising rearrangements. After a pause, while I searched for the mot just, I replied: "It's without doubt the damnedest novel I ever read.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is general satisfaction freely expressed in the clubs over the judicial action of Judge Barrett and Justice Murruy in the Gebhard-New-York Club case. That the club is a private institution with laws of its own which should not be muddled with by outside parties is the general sentiment.

docs.snippet: A charter has been received for the organization of the New-York Exchange Club. The object of this club will be to offer a resort for social intercourse to business men visiting the city. The details of the organization have not been completed. Me...
docs.lead_paragraph: A charter has been received for the organization of the New-York Exchange Club. The object of this club will be to offer a resort for social intercourse to business men visiting the city. The details of the organization have not been completed. Members will be regularly elected, and there will be two classes, residents and non-residents.

docs.snippet: A few hours after the Mets released Mike Torrez, their oldest pitcher, Dwight Gooden, their youngest one, threw seven efficient innings to win his sixth game of the season as the Mets defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 4-1, at Busch Stadium tonight...
docs.lead_paragraph: A few hours after the Mets released Mike Torrez, their oldest pitcher, Dwight Gooden, their youngest one, threw seven efficient innings to win his sixth game of the season as the Mets defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 4-1, at Busch Stadium tonight. The victory was their fourth straight and the 11th in 13 games for the Mets, who maintained a half- game lead over the Phillies and opened a game and a half lead over the Cubs in the National League East. Before the game, the Mets designated Torrez for reassignment, in effect dropping the right-handed pitcher from the roster. The Mets acquired Bruce Berenyi from the Reds Friday, and Torrez became expendable. Gooden, the 19-year-old fastball artist, struck out three batters and faced only 29 before giving way to Jesse Orosco with two out in the eighth. Orosco finished the game for his 13th save.

byline.original: By WILLIAM C. RHODEN, Special to the New York Times

byline.original: By ARTHUR DALEY It's Not in the Cards

docs.snippet: The St. Louis Cardinals snapped their seven-game losing streak tonight when they overpowered the Mets, 9-3, and sent Mike Torrez to his 17th defeat of the season.   They won it behind the five-hit pitching of John Stuper, who also knocked in two r...
docs.lead_paragraph: The St. Louis Cardinals snapped their seven-game losing streak tonight when they overpowered the Mets, 9-3, and sent Mike Torrez to his 17th defeat of the season. They won it behind the five-hit pitching of John Stuper, who also knocked in two runs with two singles. But the Cardinals, the defending champions of baseball, remained in fourth place in the National League's East, seven and a half games behind first-place Philadelphia with only 10 games to play. ''A week ago, we were only a game and a half out,'' said Whitey Herzog, the manager of the Cardinals. ''Everybody was saying we had the edge because we played our last 11 games at home. But remember what I kept saying: That, unless we played good ball in those seven final road games, the 11 at home didn't matter. And we lost all seven.''
